data.title: Amrit Rai
data.meta_description: Die indische Baumwoll Industrie; eine volkswirtschaftliche Betrachtung der Entwickslungsgeschichte der indischen Baumwollindustrie, von Dr. Amrit Rai . (1925) [Leatherbound] by Rai, Amrit, writer on cotton industries. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
LeatherBound. Condition: NEW. Leatherbound edition. Condition: New. Leather Binding on Spine and Corners with Golden leaf printing on spine. Bound in genuine leather with Satin ribbon page markers and Spine with raised gilt bands. A perfect gift for your loved ones. Reprinted from 1925 edition. NO changes have been made to the original text. This is NOT a retyped or an ocr'd reprint. Illustrations, Index, if any, are included in black and white. Each page is checked manually before printing. As this print on demand book is reprinted from a very old book, there could be some missing or flawed pages, but we always try to make the book as complete as possible. Fold-outs, if any, are not part of the book. If the original book was published in multiple volumes then this reprint is of only one volume, not the whole set. IF YOU WISH TO ORDER PARTICULAR VOLUME OR ALL THE VOLUMES YOU CAN CONTACT US. Resized as per current standards. Sewing binding for longer life, where the book block is actually sewn (smythe sewn/section sewn) with thread before binding which results in a more durable type of binding. Pages: 228 Language: German Pages: 228.

Paperback. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Some scuffing to spine ends and creasing to spine, otherwise a good clean tight copy of this soft-cover book. A biography of Dhanpat Rai Srivastava, who wrote many novels and short stories in Hindustani (Hindi) under the name Premchand between the early 1900s and his death in the 1930s. Originally published in Hindi in 1962 and in English in 1982, this is a later, paperback edition. 413pp. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. London: Xpert I, 1979. Staple-bound softcover. 30 pages including covers. Very good. Minor edgewear and creasing at corners. Some minor pulling to staples, though still tight. Bottom of page 10, written in marker and pen: "You have won Protex single, save this copy. Ring 22675 and ask for Rob. Evenings please." Nice copy of scarce 1979 London punk zine. Featuring interviews with The Police, The Members, Arturo Bassick of The Lurkers / Pinpoint, Howard Wall & Esso of The Lurkers + writing on the U.K. Subs, The Stranglers, The Fall, Patrick Fitzgerald, The Ramones, Corridor, Raincoats, Medium Medium, Essential Logic, Mekons, The Damned, The Knack and record reviews, etc.
